docs.snippet: Israeli commandos attacked Arab guerrilla bases early today in Beirut and Saida in southern Lebanon. Two prominent leaders of the Palestinian Fatah guerrilla organization were killed in the Beirut attack. The raids followed a Palestinian commando...
docs.lead_paragraph: Israeli commandos attacked Arab guerrilla bases early today in Beirut and Saida in southern Lebanon. Two prominent leaders of the Palestinian Fatah guerrilla organization were killed in the Beirut attack. The raids followed a Palestinian commando attack in Nicosia, Cyprus, yesterday. [Page 1, Column 8.

headline.main: News Summary and Index; The Major Events of the Day International Metropolitan National The Other News Quotation of the Day

docs.snippet: Experts of the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization said today that a series of bad harvests in many parts of the world--caused mainly by severe droughts-and other unfavorable factors had resulted in acute food shortages.
docs.lead_paragraph: Experts of the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization said today that a series of bad harvests in many parts of the world--caused mainly by severe droughts-and other unfavorable factors had resulted in acute food shortages.
docs.abstract: NY Times survey of world food situation notes findings of FAO that series of bad harvests, caused mainly by severe drought and other unfavorable factors, has resulted in acute food shortages; FAO officials note green revolution has greatly eased food situation in developing countries that always had to import basic foods, but that 'it has not been a universal answer, and is itself subject to many factors and limitations that are extremely difficult or beyond man's ability to control satisfactorily'; cite factors such as weather, sudden outbreaks of pests or virulent strains of plant diseases, wars and civil disturbances, and fact that high-yielding plant varieties need an abundant supply of water and fertilizers to be successful; maintain, however, that 'the record of production and growth suggests that not all has been a failure,' contending that expansion of agr output in developing countries by 2.8% annually is a 'creditable performance'; factors aggravating shortages in several areas and prospects for increased production discussed; illus

headline.main: Acute Food Shortage Found Around Globe; Fewer Calves Slaughtered Price Rise Was Surprise Australian Exports Rise Crop Failures Hurt Ocean Conditions Cited An Outstanding Advance'

docs.snippet: Guillermo Vilas and Julian Ganzabal won singles matches today to give Argentina a 2-0 lead over South Africa in Davis Cup zone tennis play.
docs.lead_paragraph: Guillermo Vilas and Julian Ganzabal won singles matches today to give Argentina a 2-0 lead over South Africa in Davis Cup zone tennis play.

headline.main: S. Africa Trails, 2-0, In Davis Cup Zone; Norway Goes 2 Up Indonesia Trails Japan

docs.snippet: South Africa won the Davis Cup tennis doubles today and trailed Argentina, 2-1, in their series. Bennie Mitton and Benert Joubert defeated the Argentine pair of Ricardo Cano and Guilermo Vilas, 6-3, 2-6, 1-6, 8-6, 6-3.
docs.lead_paragraph: South Africa won the Davis Cup tennis doubles today and trailed Argentina, 2-1, in their series. Bennie Mitton and Benert Joubert defeated the Argentine pair of Ricardo Cano and Guilermo Vilas, 6-3, 2-6, 1-6, 8-6, 6-3.

headline.main: SOUTH AFRICA TAKES DAVIS CUP DOUBLES; Norway Ousts Ireland

docs.snippet: Guillermo Vilas defeated South Africa's Deon Joubert, 6-2, 6-1, 6-1 today to enable Argentina to clinch the Davis Cup South American Zone semifinal series. The victory gave Argentina a 3-1 lead in the three-of-five match series assuring its advance...
docs.lead_paragraph: Guillermo Vilas defeated South Africa's Deon Joubert, 6-2, 6-1, 6-1 today to enable Argentina to clinch the Davis Cup South American Zone semifinal series. The victory gave Argentina a 3-1 lead in the three-of-five match series assuring its advance to the final against Chile.

headline.main: Argentina Ousts South Africa In Davis Cup Play in Uruguay; Finland, Greece Tied at 1-1

docs.snippet: The State Department charged yesterday that the film "State of Siege" besmirched the life of Dan Mitrione, an American police adviser who was slain in Uruguay by guerrillas in 1970.

docs.abstract: Leventritt, Edgar M, Foundation 28th annual Leventritt Competition set; winner receives cash prize, recording contract and engagements with 8 symphony orchestras; auditions will be given in Carnegie Hall between May 9-15; violinists from 15 nations are expected to participate in event to be held in memory of late violinist J Szigeti

docs.snippet: HE SITS there in an easy chair in, of all places, a grand Pierre Hotel suite, barely moving during a three-hour conversation. He is handsomely haggard, totally exhausted, and looks as though he hasn't slept for weeks-perhaps because of the state of...
docs.lead_paragraph: HE SITS there in an easy chair in, of all places, a grand Pierre Hotel suite, barely moving during a three-hour conversation. He is handsomely haggard, totally exhausted, and looks as though he hasn't slept for weeks-perhaps because of the state of siege between himself and the American Film Institute.
